frame.name: Delimitation_of_diversity
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Item</fen> which encompasses characteristics or types whose diversity is indicated by adducing a <fen>Limit1</fen> and a <fen>Limit2</fen> which differ considerably from each other. In some cases, the <fen>Limit2</fen> and <fen>Limit1</fen> are construed together as <fen>Limits</fen>. Alternatively, the values of a particular <fen>Variable</fen> for the <fen>Item</fen> and its <fen>Limits</fen> may be profiled.</def-root>

FE.name: Item
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity whose scalar property is specified.
</def-root>

FE.name: Limit1
FE.definition: <def-root>The first-mentioned possibility of the range of variation.</def-root>

FE.name: Limit2
FE.definition: <def-root>The second item of the range of variation.</def-root>

FE.name: Limits
FE.definition: <def-root>The range of positions on the scale that the <fen>Item</fen> occupies. <ex>Prices <t>range</t> <fex name="Limits">between 10 and 20 dollars</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The deviation of the Upper_limit and the Lower_limit from each other (and thus from some single value).
<ex>The weights <t>range</t> <fex name="Degree">a lot</fex> .</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: range.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: vary or extend between specified limits

lexUnit.name: from_to.prep
lexUnit.definition: FN: indicating extreme points of a range.
